description: 1817NA Tournament: Match 1 - bendow v srlindemann v serpentium v LenaC
title: 1817NA

actions.message: GLHF everyone!
Is there a time when we're all available to get through the initial auction live?  I'm pretty flexible, though outside of working hours in us/eastern is easier.
Iâ€™m GMT 1 https://time.is/GMT+1
I am gmt
that could be tough---I'm typically not free until 8 or 9 Eastern
Hm, that time would be fine for me, but 1-3am in Europe might be a little tricky
:tada:
woohoo!
You know that if you win the bid, you end up paying a premium for a bit great starting location, right?
Er, not great.  Stupid autocorrect.
Well, looks like I'm done for this SR :)
That's gonna be an awkward company to start out
if it speeds things up, feel free to master mode pass offering PLE for sale too
same for NYOW
I won't be selling any of my companies; feel free to pass for me
So, going to start your second company this at?
At->sr
You know your major mail contract only generates revenue when it's attached to a company with trains, right?
We've blown past my wave 2 game, and now nearly caught my wave 1
Er, sorry, wrong game :)
So, I'm not trying to apologize for choosing an aggressive strategy... But I am sorry that I chose one that involves so many actions in the stock round.
long but interesting, works for me
except for the -4 NYOW, I'm working how to make you pay for that ;)
Yeah, I'm gonna be leveraged quite heavily
Bendow, hope you survive at the end, because too many shorts too early it's often autoquit
I've tried twice and i lost quickly. Usually you wait one sr more at least
Also because the capital leveraged is really low
Yeah... This was an unusual situation.
Btw, I understand if you actually hope I go out in a spectacular explosion; we are opponents :)
Not hope, but certainty. You are going too much on negative shares. We all are going to use it
The annoying thing is that the game become weird and ugly for all the others surviving
Normally I would agree that this is way too aggressive.  But the first 4t is going to get bought before any of the companies I'm shorting will get to run.
<lightbulb>
The issue is that if one player attacks many others, they all team up not buying new trains but shuffling money and killing him
The game is a war game as Dixon commented (1870 and 1856 author) so you never want to play against the table
I know you got 3 new companies and liquidity, so maybe it will work for you. Now it is you win and we go home or viceversa
The counterpoint in this game is the loan cost. We can work getting loans in SR so that your liquidity will cost a lot. But again itâ€™s harder to coop in virtual tables than physical competition

I think driving interest rates up will hurt you more than it will me, though you can try it.  One counterpoint to your argument that everyone will team you against me is the tournament scoring, though.  Second place is worth almost as much as first, so there's incentive for people to jockey for position among themselves rather than try to take me down (especially if they suspect it won't work, or if they think someone else might play for second place)

That being said, it's certainly possible people will team up against me just because they don't like being bullied.  I try not to make this personal, but people can still take it personally, and honestly I can't really blame them; this isn't a "nice" move.

On the other hand, we can look at this as an interesting scenario, and rather than getting mad, look at it like a puzzle... How to avoid getting on the wrong side of this sort of move in the future, how to react, or even when to try something like this yourself.
(or if I have miscalculated and go down in flames, was there something I did wrong?)

There's a fine line between analyzing an interesting puzzle and obsessing over mistakes, but I think the key is to look at it as something interesting rather than something upsetting.  (Of course, that's easier for me to say in my current position, but for what it's worth that's what I hope to do even if this all goes sideways)
Sure. I dont get it personal. I've been there. Once i did little bit more aggressive and they didnt invite me anymore.
So I'm saying that in 1817 family you never want to work 1 against all-1 players. Again nothing personal, it's just a game. Not fun for now, hope fun later
Let's agree: if it works you get my congratulations on the result. If it doesn't work I will say â€œtold you soâ€ and feel betrayed from a pleasant game to a shitstorm
I've been playing 1817ish games since 2016, so my opinion is biased by my games. New players new schemes may change how i see it
Sorry :-/
Good job bendow, I dont get the table - silence, no reaction - so your move worked.
Thanks.  For what it's worth, I don't see much you could have done by the time the discussion started.
In this very specific situation at least -- this is definitely not a good general purpose strategy.
heh... I was planning to bid on GT during acquisition, but that won't happen this round
Serpentium is going to outbid us on this, but he's only allowed to bid us up by 10 each time, and he'll go into cash crisis to cover the rest of the loans.
though come to think of it, I probably should have bid it up higher, looking at the interest rates.  Oh well.
Pass forever
I was wondering if you'd do that...
I'm pretty clueless unfortunately, but seemed like _a_ thing to do
oh, definitely
That's not going to end well for you...
I don't see how you avoid bankruptcy next AR...
ah yes...I misunderstood the mechanics there. Oh well :(
I think the outcome was not in doubt in any event :D
Yeah... the distinctions between the different types of sales are hard to wrap your head around at first.
You had fun because the other players didnâ€™t know really the game. I forgot to consider that in 1817sh experience matter so much. I got their silence for shyness
Thatâ€™s why I skipped fighting, go low profile, go second
Do we call it? Or keep going? Situation is not going to change
Iâ€™m not going to bankrupt, and you win anyway 124 points
I mean 6.0 points
I think you are going bankrupt, but it won't change the standings really
Iâ€™m not. Itâ€™s not hard to avoid
So can I click on â€œend game?â€
you either need to take out a bunch of shorts in my companies, which I'm fairly sure will bankrupt you, or your 4t will rust and you'll go bankrupt
but I'm not going to worry about it either way
You are just going to score less
it's 6 points for a victory either way... it's just whether you get bonus points for having positive value at the end.
That's true. I really dont care, this game wasnt fun. So i bankrupt quickly and move one
